intro: Gypsophila umbricola, commonly known as the shadow rock beauty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial that produces small, showy blossoms in late summer, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
